AI in Finance: Anomaly Detection

Artificial Intelligence (AI) has transformed the financial industry by enabling real-time fraud detection, predictive analytics, and personalized financial services. One key application is anomaly detection, which identifies irregular patterns in transaction data to prevent fraud and ensure compliance.

Data and Security Issues

AI systems rely on large datasets, which may contain biases or sensitive information. Risks include data breaches, model manipulation, and lack of transparency in decision-making. Ensuring privacy and security is critical for responsible AI deployment.

Positive Impact

AI improves fraud prevention, reduces financial losses, and enhances trust in financial systems. It also enables financial inclusion through microloans and personalized services for underserved populations.

Negative Impact

AI can unintentionally exclude vulnerable groups due to biased training data. It may also amplify existing inequalities and pose ethical concerns if not properly managed.
